DOC.brief_summary: The investigator compare advantage disadvantage two form noninvasive respiratory support —noninvasive high-frequency ventilation ( nHFV ) nasal continuous positive airway pressure ( nCPAP ) —as primary mode ventilation premature infant RDS．
DOC.brief_title: NHFOV vs. NCPAP Primary Treatment Neonatal Respiratory Distress Syndrome ( NRDS )
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator enrol preterm infant 8 neonatal intensive care unit China . Infants eligible gestational age le 35 week RDS candidate noninvasive respiratory support . Infants exclude diagnosed white lung , congenital abnormality , hypercapnia . The parameter concentration inhalation oxygen ( FiO2 ) adjust accord percutaneous oxygen saturation blood gas analysis.The primary outcome ratio intubation fail non-invasive ventilation , period non-invasive ventilation succeed non-invasive ventilation , morbidity bronchopulmonary dysplasia .
DOC.criteria: Gestational age < 35 week ; Diagnosed neonatal respiratory distress syndrome ; Inhalation atmospheric condition , blood oxygen partial pressure ( PaO2 ) < 6.7kPa Neonatal respiratory distress syndrome Grade Ⅳ ( White Lung ) ; Hypercapnia（pH < 7.20 , PaCO2﹥8.0kPa ) ; Respiratory malformation Complexity congenital heart disease ; Severe circulatory dysfunction
